synopsis: In episode #9, the hosts Devam and Ahir engage in a lively conversation with guest Vivek Menon about his journey in filmmaking, the creative process behind his show 'New Normal,' and the importance of embracing one's identity as an artist. The discussion highlights the value of storytelling, the challenges of collaboration, and the joys of pursuing passion projects, all while maintaining a light-hearted and humorous tone.
quotes: Your experience and your voice are the most unique things you can write.
The best way of learning is by doing it and putting yourself out there.
If you spend so much time making something, you can't even watch it with people who are supporting youâ€”that's ridiculous.
You should call yourself a filmmaker; you are one.
Your idea of success is what you make of it.
Art is not about the end result; it's about the journey you take to get there.
It's okay to have a million creative conflicts; that's part of the process.
If you're putting yourself out there and creating something, that's already a win.
There are people out there who really enjoy content that might not resonate with you.
The script is never done until the moment you shoot it.
